mu8 LOCAL mu8

NAME

mjo_u8_calc — determine if an octet is the start of a UTF-8 sequence

SYNOPSIS

#include <mu8.h>

void
mjo_u8_calc(int *const o_legal, size_t *const o_octets, unsigned char const i_octet);

DESCRIPTION

mjo_u8_calc() shall determine if i_octet is the start of a UTF-8 sequence.

Following is a description of the arguments.

o_legal
pointer to an ‘int’ (boolean) indicator that shall be set to whether or not the octet is valid
o_octets
pointer to a ‘size_t’ that shall be set to the count of octets required to compose a complete UTF-8 character.
i_octet
octet to validate

If o_legal is nil, it shall not be set.

If o_octets. is nil, it shall not be set.

If i_octet is the start of an UTF-8 sequence, *o_legal shall be set to true and *o_octets shall be set to the count of octets required to compose the character.

If i_octet is an invalid leading UTF-8 byte, *o_legal shall be set to false and *o_octets shall be set to zero.

SEE ALSO

mjo_u8_validate(3) mjo_u8_validate_nth_sequence(3)

July 22, 2020 OpenBSD 7.0
